name: Peanut Tempeh Stir Fry
description: Easy Peanut Tempeh Stir Fry is made in one skillet and ready in 30 minutes. The pan fried tempeh and veggies are drowned in a savory peanut sauce to give this dish loads of flavor!
recipeIngredient: cooked brown/white rice or noodles, for serving

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together all of the peanut sauce ingredients until smooth. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium bowl, whisk together all of the peanut sauce ingredients until smooth. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large wok or skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium-high heat.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large wok or skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium-high heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the onion and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring constantly until it starts to soften.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the onion and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring constantly until it starts to soften.

recipeInstructions.text: Now add the tempeh and stir fry for another 5 minutes, stirring frequently.
recipeInstructions.name: Now add the tempeh and stir fry for another 5 minutes, stirring frequently.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the tempeh and onions from the skillet and set on a plate nearby.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the tempeh and onions from the skillet and set on a plate nearby.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the remaining olive oil and the broccoli and carrots. Stir fry for 3-4 minutes until crisp tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the remaining olive oil and the broccoli and carrots. Stir fry for 3-4 minutes until crisp tender.

recipeInstructions.text: Return the tempeh and onions to the pan, along with the sauce. Stir to coat and cook for about 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Return the tempeh and onions to the pan, along with the sauce. Stir to coat and cook for about 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Turn off the heat, sprinkle with chopped peanuts and cilantro, if desired. Serve over noodles or with rice.
recipeInstructions.name: Turn off the heat, sprinkle with chopped peanuts and cilantro, if desired. Serve over noodles or with rice.
